member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.CoerceHomogeneousCoordinates(MathNet.Numerics.LinearAlgebra.Vector{System.Numerics.Complex})
member.summary:
Consider the vector to be a homogeneous vector and simplify it.
When the vector is homogeneous real, its values will be made real.
A homogeneous factor will be applied to prevent the coordinates from becoming too large.
Values of the vector will be coerced to a whole number, a simple fraction or 0 within a certain precision.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.LinearDependant(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary:
Calculate the complex factor f so that array B = f * array A.
When the arrays A and B are not linear dependent the return value is 'null'.
Zero arrays or invalid arrays will also return 'null'.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.LinearDependentFactors(Geometry.Projective.HVector,Geometry.Projective.HVector,Geometry.Projective.HVector)
member.summary:
Calculate the factors a, b so that C = a * A + b * B.
When the Hvectors A, B and C are not linear dependent (i.e. not collinear) the return value is 'null'.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.LinearDependentFactor(Geometry.Projective.Vector3,Geometry.Projective.Vector3)
member.summary:
Calculate the factor f so that B = f * A.
When the 3D-vectors A and B are not linear dependent the return value is 'null'.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.CrossProduct(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Calculate the cross product from 2 vectors with each 3 entries.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.PlueckerProduct(MathNet.Numerics.LinearAlgebra.Vector{System.Numerics.Complex},MathNet.Numerics.LinearAlgebra.Vector{System.Numerics.Complex})
member.summary: Calculate the Pl√ºcker coordinates (p01, p02, p03, p23, p31, p12) from 2 vectors with each 4 entries.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.ImaginaryHVector(Geometry.Projective.HVector,Geometry.Projective.HVector,Geometry.Projective.HVector)
member.summary:
Calculate the imaginary HVector that is represented by the projectivity ABC -> BCA.
The return value and its complex conjugate are the invariant imaginary points for this projectivity
When the Hvectors A, B and C are not linear dependent (i.e. not collinear) the return value is 'null'.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.CanonicalTransformation(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Geometry.Projective.HVector})
member.summary:
Calculate the homogeneous matrix that transforms the canonical frame, i.e. the canonical base together with the unit homogeneous vector, into a given set of independent homogeneous vectors.
Only spatial dimensions 1, 2 and 3 are supported, i.e. 3 homogeneous vectors with each 2 coordinates, 4 homogeneous vectors with each 3 coordinates or 5 homogeneous vectors with each 4 coordinates.
An exception is thrown when any smaller subset of the homogeneous vectors is linear dependant.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.CrossRatio(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Geometry.Projective.HVector})
member.summary:
Calculate the cross ration of four hvectors, i.e. 4 points, 4 lines, 4 planes.
The first three elements will be considered as the base, w.r.t. which the cross ration of the fourth element will be calculated.
In the case of two or three dimensions an exception is thrown when the elements are not in a pencil.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.CrossRatio(Geometry.Projective.HVector[])
member.summary:
Calculate the cross ration of four homogeneous vectors, i.e. 4 points, 4 lines, 4 planes.
The first three elements will be considered as the base, w.r.t. which the cross ration of the fourth element will be calculated.
First element = origin, second element = infinity, third element = unity.
An exception is thrown when the elements are not in a pencil.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Extensions.CrossRatio(Geometry.Projective.Set{Geometry.Projective.HVector})
member.summary:
Calculate the cross ration of four hvectors, i.e. 4 points, 4 lines, 4 planes.
The first three elements will be considered as the base, w.r.t. which the cross ration of the fourth element will be calculated.
In the case of two or three dimensions an exception is thrown when the elements are not in a pencil.

member.name: T:Geometry.Projective.HVector
member.summary:
A homogeneous vector with at least two homogeneous coordinates (complex or real) using dense storage.
When all coordinates are 0, or one of the coordinates is NaN, the vector is invalid.
The coordinates are immutable.

At least two coordinates are required and the zero vector is forbidden.

member.name: M:Geometry.Projective.Projection.#ctor(Geometry.Projective.Point3D,Geometry.Projective.Plane3D)
member.summary:
Create a new projection from a center onto a plane.
The default center of projection is the point of infinity of the x-axis.
Optionally specify a real point as the center of projection.
The default plane of projection is the YZ-plane.
Optionally specify a real plane (not at infinity) on which to project.
The center must not lie in the plane of projection.

member.summary:
The values of the non-singular 3x3 matrix determine the projectivity.
It must be specified whether the values of the matrix have to be interpreted as pointwise (contravariant) or hyperplanewise (covariant) values.
In other words whether the matrix transforms points into points (pointwise, contravariant) or lines into lines (hyperplanewise, covariant).

member.name: T:Geometry.Projective.Point3D
member.summary:
A homogeneous vector with 4 complex (or real) homogeneous coordinates, representing a point in 3-dimensional projective space.
When the first coordinate is 0, the point is at infinity.
When the first coordinate is 1, the other 3 coordinates are the affine or euclidean coordinates of the point.

member.name: T:Geometry.Projective.Plane3D
member.summary:
A homogeneous vector with 4 complex (or real) homogeneous coordinates, representing a plane in 3-dimensional projective space.
Indices 1, 2, 3 give the Euclidean coordinates of the vector normal to the plane.
Index 0 divided by the norm of the normal vector gives the distance of the plane with respect to the origin.

member.name: T:Geometry.Projective.CoordinateType
member.summary:
Indicates whether the coordinates belong to:
- a pointwise (contravariant) vector
- a hyperplanewise (covariant) vector
- or: undetermined.

member.name: F:Geometry.Projective.CoordinateType.Pointwise
member.summary:
Point coordinates or derived from point coordinates.
Also: 0-dimensional subpsace (point), contravariant.

member.name: F:Geometry.Projective.CoordinateType.Hyperplanewise
member.summary:
Hyperplane coordinates or derived from hyperplane coordinates.
Also: n-1-dimensional subpsace (line in 2 dimensions, plane in 3 dimensions), covariant.
